msContents.summary: List of metropolites in 1b: each name is followed by the names of taxes and amounts of money; most taxes fall under the category of garden and vineyard taxes. In 1a there are balances of tax collections in money without the names of the individual taxpayers; this document is not an official report, it is rather the work sheet of the tax collectors

msItem.note: Written across the fibers; on the front P.Col. V 1 recto 1a + 1b
Four and a half cols. of writing with 88 lines in 1b; 7 cols. with 105 lines of writing in 1a
1b is written in a careless cursive hand
1a is written in a clear vertical hand that is the same as the hand of BGU IX 1894, a similar document which is more detailed and contains an account for the toparchy
The register of 1b contains unpaid remainders, some of which were probably arrears
Sometimes in 1b the name of the tax called "geometria" is not given
In 1b are listed 40 Arsinoites, seven of whom were given official titles, which replaced patronymics
Lines 5-50 of 1a contain payments charged to the "current year," while the second section lists receipts charged to the preceding year

The names that appear in 1b were copied from a larger register, in the order in which they appeared there, and are not in alphabetical order; the larger register probably contained the names of all holders of land in the area of Theadelphia with assessments and payments with dates

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 1,3 and 9 (Lot II) in Bell

keywords.term: Aurelius Alkimos alias Dionysios, -- also in verso 6
Didyme alias Matrona, -- daughter of Asklepiades, also in verso 6

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. V 1 verso 1b + 1a For the people cf. P.Stras. IX 846 and 891; about echthesis see BL IV p. 21; about line 4, see Sijpesteijn, ZPE 54 (1984) 69 and note 20. Correction, line 14, BL X p. 40.
